verses.verse: וְאִשָּׁ֣ה <S%H802><s%> ve-'ish-Shah woman אַחַ֣ת <S%H259><s%> 'a-Chat a certain מִנְּשֵׁ֣י <S%H802><s%> min-ne-Shei of the wives בְנֵֽי־ <S%H1121><s%> ve-nei- of the sons הַ֠נְּבִיאִים <S%H5030><s%> Han-ne-vi-'im of the prophets צָעֲקָ֨ה <S%H6817><s%> tza-'a-Kah Now there cried אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to אֱלִישָׁ֜ע <S%H477><s%> 'e-li-Sha' unto Elisha לֵאמֹ֗ר <S%H559><s%> le-Mor, saying עַבְדְּךָ֤ <S%H5650><s%> 'av-de-Cha Thy servant אִישִׁי֙ <S%H376><s%> 'i-Shi my husband מֵ֔ת <S%H4191><s%> Met, is dead וְאַתָּ֣ה <S%H859><s%> ve-'at-Tah and you יָדַ֔עְתָּ <S%H3045><s%> ya-Da'-ta, and thou knowest כִּ֣י <S%H3588><s%> ki that עַבְדְּךָ֔ <S%H5650><s%> 'av-de-Cha, that thy servant הָיָ֥ה <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yah become יָרֵ֖א <S%H3372><s%> ya-Re feared אֶת־ <S%H853><s%> 'et- יְהוָ֑ה <S%H3068><s%> Yah-weh; the LORD וְהַ֨נֹּשֶׁ֔ה <S%H5383><s%> ve-Han-no-Sheh, and the creditor בָּ֗א <S%H935><s%> Ba, is come לָקַ֜חַת <S%H3947><s%> la-Ka-chat to take אֶת־ <S%H853><s%> 'et- שְׁנֵ֧י <S%H8147><s%> she-Nei unto him my two יְלָדַ֛י <S%H3206><s%> ye-la-Dai sons ל֖וֹ lo לַעֲבָדִֽים׃ <S%H5650><s%> la-'a-va-Dim. to be bondmen

וַיֹּ֨אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer said אֵלֶ֤יהָ <S%H413><s%> 'e-Lei-ha about אֱלִישָׁע֙ <S%H477><s%> 'e-li-Sha' And Elisha מָ֣ה <S%H4100><s%> mah to her What אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־ <S%H6213><s%> 'e-'e-seh- unto her What shall I do לָּ֔ךְ Lach, הַגִּ֣ידִי <S%H5046><s%> hag-Gi-di for thee;tell לִ֔י Li, מַה־ <S%H4100><s%> mah- what יֶּשׁ־ <S%H3426><s%> yesh- me what hast; לְכִי le-chi כלָ֖ךְ Lach קבַּבָּ֑יִת <S%H1004><s%> bab-Ba-yit; hath not any thing in the house וַתֹּ֗אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vat-To-mer, said אֵ֣ין <S%H369><s%> 'ein has לְשִׁפְחָתְךָ֥ <S%H8198><s%> le-shif-cha-te-Cha Thine handmaid כֹל֙ <S%H3605><s%> chol in בַּבַּ֔יִת <S%H1004><s%> bab-Ba-yit, the house כִּ֖י <S%H3588><s%> ki for אִם־ <S%H518><s%> 'im- lo אָס֥וּךְ <S%H610><s%> 'a-Such save a pot שָֽׁמֶן׃ <S%H8081><s%> Sha-men. of oil

וַיֹּ֗אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer, Then he said לְכִ֨י <S%H1980><s%> le-Chi Go שַׁאֲלִי־ <S%H7592><s%> sha-'a-li- borrow לָ֤ךְ lach כֵּלִים֙ <S%H3627><s%> ke-Lim thee vessels מִן־ <S%H4480><s%> min- at הַח֔וּץ <S%H2351><s%> ha-Chutz, abroad מֵאֵ֖ת <S%H853><s%> me-'Et כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all; שִׁכְנָכֵי shich-na-chei כשְׁכֵנָ֑יִךְ <S%H7934><s%> she-che-Na-yich; inhabitant קכֵּלִ֥ים <S%H3627><s%> ke-Lim vessels רֵקִ֖ים <S%H7386><s%> re-Kim [even] empty אַל־ <S%H408><s%> 'al- not תַּמְעִֽיטִי׃ <S%H4591><s%> tam-'I-ti. borrow not a few

וּבָ֗את <S%H935><s%> u-Vat, And when thou art come in וְסָגַ֤רְתְּ <S%H5462><s%> ve-sa-Gart thou shalt shut הַדֶּ֙לֶת֙ <S%H1817><s%> had-De-let the door בַּעֲדֵ֣ךְ <S%H1157><s%> ba-'a-Dech behind וּבְעַד־ <S%H1157><s%> u-ve-'ad- behind בָּנַ֔יִךְ <S%H1121><s%> ba-Na-yich, upon thee and upon thy sons וְיָצַ֕קְתְּ <S%H3332><s%> ve-ya-Tzakt and shalt pour out עַ֥ל <S%H5921><s%> 'al out כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all הַכֵּלִ֖ים <S%H3627><s%> hak-ke-Lim into all those vessels הָאֵ֑לֶּה <S%H428><s%> ha-'El-leh; these וְהַמָּלֵ֖א <S%H4392><s%> ve-ham-ma-Le that which is full תַּסִּֽיעִי׃ <S%H5265><s%> tas-Si-'i. and thou shalt set aside

וַתֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ <S%H1980><s%> vat-Te-lech went מֵֽאִתּ֔וֹ <S%H853><s%> me-'it-To, וַתִּסְגֹּ֣ר <S%H5462><s%> vat-tis-Gor from him and shut הַדֶּ֔לֶת <S%H1817><s%> had-De-let, the door בַּעֲדָ֖הּ <S%H1157><s%> ba-'a-Dah upon her and upon וּבְעַ֣ד <S%H1157><s%> u-ve-'Ad behind בָּנֶ֑יהָ <S%H1121><s%> ba-Nei-ha; her sons הֵ֛ם <S%H1992><s%> hem who מַגִּשִׁ֥ים <S%H5066><s%> mag-gi-Shim brought אֵלֶ֖יהָ <S%H413><s%> 'e-Lei-ha about וְהִ֥יא <S%H1931><s%> ve-Hi he; מֵיצָקֶת mei-tza-ket כמֹוצָֽקֶת׃ <S%H3332><s%> mo-Tza-ket. cast ק

וַיְהִ֣י׀ <S%H1961><s%> vay-Hi become כִּמְלֹ֣את <S%H4390><s%> kim-Lot were full הַכֵּלִ֗ים <S%H3627><s%> hak-ke-Lim, And it came to pass when the vessels וַתֹּ֤אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vat-To-mer that she said אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to her בְּנָהּ֙ <S%H1121><s%> be-Nah unto her son הַגִּ֨ישָׁה <S%H5066><s%> hag-Gi-shah Bring אֵלַ֥י <S%H413><s%> 'e-Lai about עוֹד֙ <S%H5750><s%> 'Od another כֶּ֔לִי <S%H3627><s%> Ke-li, me yet a vessel וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer And he said אֵלֶ֔יהָ <S%H413><s%> 'e-Lei-ha, to her אֵ֥ין <S%H369><s%> 'ein There ע֖וֹד <S%H5750><s%> od more כֶּ֑לִי <S%H3627><s%> Ke-li; unto her [There is] not a vessel וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד <S%H5975><s%> vai-ya-'a-Mod stayed הַשָּֽׁמֶן׃ <S%H8081><s%> hash-Sha-men. more And the oil

וַתָּבֹ֗א <S%H935><s%> vat-ta-Vo, Then she came וַתַּגֵּד֙ <S%H5046><s%> vat-tag-Ged and told לְאִ֣ישׁ <S%H376><s%> le-'Ish the man הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים <S%H430><s%> ha-'E-lo-Him, of God וַיֹּ֗אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer, And he said לְכִי֙ <S%H1980><s%> le-Chi Go מִכְרִ֣י <S%H4376><s%> mich-Ri sell אֶת־ <S%H853><s%> 'et- הַשֶּׁ֔מֶן <S%H8081><s%> hash-She-men, the oil וְשַׁלְּמִ֖י <S%H7999><s%> ve-shal-le-Mi and pay אֶת־ <S%H853><s%> 'et- ; נִשְׁיֵכִי nish-ye-chi כנִשְׁיֵ֑ךְ <S%H5386><s%> nish-Yech; debt קוְאַ֣תְּ <S%H859><s%> ve-'At you; בְּנֵיכִי be-nei-chi כוּבָנַ֔יִךְ <S%H1121><s%> u-va-Na-yich, afflicted קתִֽחְיִ֖י <S%H2421><s%> tich-Yi and live בַּנּוֹתָֽר׃ <S%H3498><s%> ban-no-Tar. of the rest פ Peh

וַיְהִ֨י <S%H1961><s%> vay-Hi came הַיּ֜וֹם <S%H3117><s%> hai-Yom And it fell on a day וַיַּעֲבֹ֧ר <S%H5674><s%> vai-ya-'a-Vor passed אֱלִישָׁ֣ע <S%H477><s%> 'e-li-Sha' that Elisha אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to שׁוּנֵ֗ם <S%H7766><s%> shu-Nem, to Shunem וְשָׁם֙ <S%H8033><s%> ve-Sham where אִשָּׁ֣ה <S%H802><s%> 'ish-Shah woman גְדוֹלָ֔ה <S%H1419><s%> ge-do-Lah, where [was] a great וַתַּחֲזֶק־ <S%H2388><s%> vat-ta-cha-zek- and she constrained בּ֖וֹ bo לֶאֱכָל־ <S%H398><s%> le-'e-chol- him to eat לָ֑חֶם <S%H3899><s%> La-chem; bread וַֽיְהִי֙ <S%H1961><s%> vay-Hi came מִדֵּ֣י <S%H1767><s%> mid-Dei And [so] it was [that] as oft עָבְר֔וֹ <S%H5674><s%> a-ve-Ro, as he passed by יָסֻ֥ר <S%H5493><s%> ya-Sur he turned שָׁ֖מָּה <S%H8033><s%> Sham-mah there לֶאֱכָל־ <S%H398><s%> le-'e-chol- in thither to eat לָֽחֶם׃ <S%H3899><s%> La-chem. bread

וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ <S%H559><s%> vat-To-mer And she said אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to her אִישָׁ֔הּ <S%H376><s%> 'i-Shah, unto her husband הִנֵּה־ <S%H2009><s%> hin-neh- Behold נָ֣א <S%H4994><s%> na now יָדַ֔עְתִּי <S%H3045><s%> ya-Da'-ti, Behold now I perceive כִּ֛י <S%H3588><s%> ki for אִ֥ישׁ <S%H376><s%> 'ish man אֱלֹהִ֖ים <S%H430><s%> E-lo-Him of God קָד֣וֹשׁ <S%H6918><s%> ka-Doosh that this [is] an holy ה֑וּא <S%H1931><s%> Hu; this עֹבֵ֥ר <S%H5674><s%> 'o-Ver which passeth עָלֵ֖ינוּ <S%H5921><s%> 'a-Lei-nu and תָּמִֽיד׃ <S%H8548><s%> ta-Mid. by us continually

נַֽעֲשֶׂה־ <S%H6213><s%> na-'a-seh- Let us make נָּ֤א <S%H4994><s%> na Please עֲלִיַּת־ <S%H5944><s%> 'a-li-yat- chamber קִיר֙ <S%H7023><s%> kir I pray thee on the wall קְטַנָּ֔ה <S%H6996><s%> ke-tan-Nah, a little וְנָשִׂ֨ים <S%H7760><s%> ve-na-Sim and let us set ל֥וֹ lo שָׁ֛ם <S%H8033><s%> sham there מִטָּ֥ה <S%H4296><s%> mit-Tah for him there a bed וְשֻׁלְחָ֖ן <S%H7979><s%> ve-shul-Chan and a table וְכִסֵּ֣א <S%H3678><s%> ve-chis-Se and a stool וּמְנוֹרָ֑ה <S%H4501><s%> u-me-no-Rah; and a candlestick וְהָיָ֛ה <S%H1961><s%> ve-ha-Yah become בְּבֹא֥וֹ <S%H935><s%> be-vo-'O and it shall be when he cometh אֵלֵ֖ינוּ <S%H413><s%> 'e-Lei-nu to us יָס֥וּר <S%H5493><s%> ya-Sur to us that he shall turn שָֽׁמָּה׃ <S%H8033><s%> Sham-mah. there

וַיְהִ֥י <S%H1961><s%> vay-Hi become הַיּ֖וֹם <S%H3117><s%> hai-Yom And it fell on a day וַיָּ֣בֹא <S%H935><s%> vai-Ya-vo that he came שָׁ֑מָּה <S%H8033><s%> Sham-mah; there וַיָּ֥סַר <S%H5493><s%> vai-Ya-sar thither and he turned אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to הָעֲלִיָּ֖ה <S%H5944><s%> ha-'a-li-Yah into the chamber וַיִּשְׁכַּב־ <S%H7901><s%> vai-yish-kav- and lay שָֽׁמָּה׃ <S%H8033><s%> Sham-mah. there

וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer And he said אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to גֵּחֲזִ֣י <S%H1522><s%> ge-cha-Zi to Gehazi נַעֲר֔וֹ <S%H5288><s%> na-'a-Ro, his servant קְרָ֖א <S%H7121><s%> ke-Ra Call לַשּׁוּנַמִּ֣ית <S%H7767><s%> lash-shu-nam-Mit this Shunammite הַזֹּ֑את <S%H2063><s%> haz-Zot; he וַיִּקְרָא־ <S%H7121><s%> vai-yik-ra- And when he had called לָ֔הּ Lah, וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד <S%H5975><s%> vat-ta-'a-Mod her she stood לְפָנָֽיו׃ <S%H6440><s%> le-fa-Nav. before

וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer And he said ל֗וֹ lo, אֱמָר־ <S%H559><s%> 'e-mor- unto him Say נָ֣א <S%H4994><s%> na now אֵלֶיהָ֮ <S%H413><s%> 'e-lei-Ha to her הִנֵּ֣ה <S%H2009><s%> hin-Neh Behold חָרַ֣דְתְּ׀ <S%H2729><s%> cha-Radt now unto her Behold thou hast been careful אֵלֵינוּ֮ <S%H413><s%> 'e-lei-Nu about אֶת־ <S%H854><s%> 'et- with כָּל־ <S%H3605><s%> kol- all הַחֲרָדָ֣ה <S%H2731><s%> ha-cha-ra-Dah for us with all this care הַזֹּאת֒ <S%H2063><s%> haz-zoT likewise מֶ֚ה <S%H4100><s%> meh what לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת <S%H6213><s%> la-'a-Sot what [is] to be done לָ֔ךְ Lach, הֲיֵ֤שׁ <S%H3426><s%> ha-Yesh for thee;wouldest לְדַבֶּר־ <S%H1696><s%> le-dab-ber- thou be spoken לָךְ֙ loCh אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ <S%H4428><s%> ham-Me-lech, for to the king א֖וֹ <S%H176><s%> o or אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to שַׂ֣ר <S%H8269><s%> sar or to the captain הַצָּבָ֑א <S%H6635><s%> hatz-tza-Va; appointed time וַתֹּ֕אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vat-To-mer Say בְּת֥וֹךְ <S%H8432><s%> be-Toch among עַמִּ֖י <S%H5971><s%> 'am-Mi mine own people אָנֹכִ֥י <S%H595><s%> 'a-no-Chi I יֹשָֽׁבֶת׃ <S%H3427><s%> yo-Sha-vet. I dwell

וַיֹּ֕אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer And he said וּמֶ֖ה <S%H4100><s%> u-Meh What לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת <S%H6213><s%> la-'a-Sot What then [is] to be done לָ֑הּ Lah; וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer answered גֵּיחֲזִ֗י <S%H1522><s%> gei-cha-Zi, for her;And Gehazi אֲבָ֛ל <S%H61><s%> 'a-Val Verily בֵּ֥ן <S%H1121><s%> ben she hath no child אֵֽין־ <S%H369><s%> 'ein- has לָ֖הּ lah וְאִישָׁ֥הּ <S%H376><s%> ve-'i-Shah and her husband זָקֵֽן׃ <S%H2204><s%> za-Ken. is old

וַיֹּ֖אמֶר <S%H559><s%> vai-Yo-mer And he said קְרָא־ <S%H7121><s%> ke-ra- Call לָ֑הּ Lah; וַיִּקְרָא־ <S%H7121><s%> vai-yik-ra- her And when he had called לָ֔הּ Lah, וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד <S%H5975><s%> vat-ta-'a-Mod her she stood בַּפָּֽתַח׃ <S%H6607><s%> bap-Pa-tach. in the door
